name: Bing–Borsuk conjecture
rephrased: A space is a topological n-manifold if it is homogeneous and an absolute neighborhood retract (ANR) of dimension n.
implication_form: If a space is n-dimensional, homogeneous, and an absolute neighborhood retract (ANR), then it is a topological n-manifold.
explained: The Bing–Borsuk conjecture states that every n-dimensional homogeneous absolute neighborhood retract (ANR) is a topological n-manifold.
